channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Carvana's father-son founding duo have made $11bn during 3,000% stock rebound
item.description: The one-day surge pushed the older Garcia’s fortune to $10.9 billion from a 2022 low of $3.1 billion, while his son’s net worth climbed to $3.8 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

item.title: Friday's analyst calls: Street reacts to Apple buybacks and Coinbase earnings
item.description: This is CNBC Pro's live coverage of Friday's analyst calls and Wall Street chatter.

item.title: Norway's $1.6tn oil fund CEO—who said Americans work harder than Europeans—has a countdown in his office to show how many days he has left on he job
item.description: "Now why do I have that? Is it because I don't like my job? No. I love my job."

item.title: Turkey's inflation accelerates to nearly 70% in April
item.description: Turkey's inflation accelerated to 69.8% annually for the month of April, the Turkish Statistical Institute reported Friday.

item.title: 7-to-7 is the new 9-to-5: Research shows that workers’ days in the office are fewer but longer than pre-pandemic
item.description: Sorry, Dolly Parton working nine to five is no longer a way to make a living.

item.title: Japan's yen had a rollercoaster week amid suspected intervention. Here's what you need to know
item.description: The Japanese yen started the week at 34-year lows against the U.S. dollar but the currency is now staring at its best week in over a year on Friday.

item.title: Nippon Steel is putting off its $14.1bn takeover of U.S. Steel by 3 months
item.description: The new timing could push the closing beyond the election, but Nippon Steel denied the delay was related to that.

item.title: Britain's ruling Conservatives hit with another local defeat as general election nears
item.description: The votes are likely to be the last major political test for U.K. leader Rishi Sunak's Conservative Party ahead of a general election later this year.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds blasts ‘the thick buttress of bureaucracy' slowing Wrexham stadium expansion
item.description: Reynolds and co-owner Rob McElhenney have run into scrapes with regulators over their attempts to expand Wrexham's Racecourse stadium.

item.title: Credit Agricole's first-quarter earnings jump as investment banking beats rivals
item.description: European banks' first-quarter earnings have largely beaten expectations, with the boost from higher interest rates still supporting lenders' bottom line.
